posts.cooked: Pathplanner keeps overshooting where the robot is in the simulator but in reality it is going the correct distance. Where in the odometry do I correct for this?
Have you looked at your pid values?

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: We had this exact issue and couldn’t figure it out. It was PID , please tune your robot well.
I was able to tune the pid to where it would kind of follow the path. But when I actually tried testing it the robot would barely move.

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: do you have a link to your code? Are you using yagsl, ctre swerve generator, or any sort of template?

yagsl,

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked:
Did you follow this page from the docs when tuning your pidf?:

Your values honestly look weird imo

posts.name: Ethan
posts.cooked: This looks like an issue with the simulator. Typically setting p to 5 works for pathplanner and it looks like the simulator treats the values as much higher than they actually are.
